document.discussion_title: Where to go for help | A new era in emergency care
document.topic_text: Where to go for help You are here Home / Where to go for help Changes to emergency care across Northumberland and North Tyneside As of 16 June 2015, emergency care has changed across Northumberland and North Tyneside. Serious or life threatening emergencies are now cared for at the new Northumbria Specialist Emergency Care Hospital in Cramlington. Urgent but less serious conditions are cared for at 24 hour walk-in services at Hexham, North Tyneside and Wansbeck general hospitals . Your GP can treat the majority of healthcare needs and are the first point of contact for most medical problems for you and your family. For more information on where to go for help please click on either of the visuals below or the booklet (right).
